qas.question: How many games made up the AFL season in 2003?
In what year did the rules first forbid players running out of bounds?
In what year was the ArenaBowl first played at a neutral location?
What year introduced the free substitution rule?
What year saw a rules change that had an impact on the role of the "jack" linebacker?

context: In 2003, the season expanded to <a0_0>16<a0_0/> games. There were also several rule changes in this period. In <a1_0><a2_0>2005<a2_0/><a1_0/>, players were no longer allowed to run out of bounds. The only way for a player to go out of bounds presently is if he is tackled into or deliberately contacts the side boards. This was also the first year the ArenaBowl was played at a neutral site. In <a3_0>2007<a3_0/>, free substitution was allowed, ending the "iron man" era of one-platoon football. And in <a4_0>2008<a4_0/>, the "jack" linebacker was allowed to go sideboard to sideboard without being penalized for "illegal defense".
